title: ECCV_2016_212_abs

sentences.text: Person re-identification is challenging due to the large variations of pose , illumination , occlusion and camera view .

Owing to these variations , the pedestrian data is distributed as highly-curved manifolds in the feature space , despite the current convolutional neural networks -LRB- CNN -RRB- 's capability of feature extraction .
However , the distribution is unknown , so it is difficult to use the geodesic distance when comparing two samples .
In practice , the current deep embedding methods use the Euclidean distance for the training and test .

On the other hand , the manifold learning methods suggest to use the Euclidean distance in the local range , combining with the graphical relationship between samples , for approximating the geodesic distance .

From this point of view , selecting suitable positive -LRB- i.e. intra-class -RRB- training samples within a local range is critical for training the CNN embedding , especially when the data has large intra-class variations .
In this paper , we propose a novel moderate positive sample mining method to train robust CNN for person re-identification , dealing with the problem of large variation .
In addition , we improve the learning by a metric weight constraint , so that the learned metric has a better generalization ability .

Experiments show that these two strategies are effective in learning robust deep metrics for person re-identification , and accordingly our deep model significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art methods on several benchmarks of person re-identification .
Therefore , the study presented in this paper may be useful in inspiring new designs of deep models for person re-identification .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper proposes a novel moderate positive sample mining method to train robust Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for person re-identification, addressing the problem of large variation.

Entity-novel_moderate_positive_sample_mi.label: novel moderate positive sample mining method

Entity-novel_moderate_positive_sample_mi.description: A proposed algorithm or technique used to select suitable intra-class training samples within a local range to train robust CNN models for person re-identification, dealing with large variations.

summary: Person re-identification is challenging due to the large variations of pose , illumination , occlusion and camera view . Owing to these variations , the pedestrian data is distributed as highly-curved manifolds in the feature space , despite the current convolutional neural networks -LRB- CNN -RRB- 's capability of feature extraction . However , the distribution is unknown , so it is difficult to use the geodesic distance when comparing two samples . In practice , the current deep embedding methods use the Euclidean distance for the training and test . On the other hand , the manifold learning methods suggest to use the Euclidean distance in the local range , combining with the graphical relationship between samples , for approximating the geodesic distance . From this point of view , selecting suitable positive -LRB- i.e. intra-class -RRB- training samples within a local range is critical for training the CNN embedding , especially when the data has large intra-class variations . In this paper , we propose a novel moderate positive sample mining method to train robust CNN for person re-identification , dealing with the problem of large variation . In addition , we improve the learning by a metric weight constraint , so that the learned metric has a better generalization ability . Experiments show that these two strategies are effective in learning robust deep metrics for person re-identification , and accordingly our deep model significantly outperforms the state-of-the-art methods on several benchmarks of person re-identification . Therefore , the study presented in this paper may be useful in inspiring new designs of deep models for person re-identification .

Predicate-is_challenging_due_to.label: is challenging due to
Predicate-is_challenging_due_to.description: The predicate 'is challenging due to' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the difficulty or complexity of the task (subject) arises from, or is influenced by, some specific factor or condition (object). In general, this predicate highlights an obstacle or hindrance that must be overcome in order to successfully accomplish the task.

Predicate-variations_of.label: variations of
Predicate-variations_of.description: The predicate 'variations of' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject represents different forms or manifestations of something that can be categorized under the broader concept denoted by the object. In general, this predicate suggests a connection between the subject's specific instances and the object's overarching category.

Predicate-distributed_as.label: distributed as
Predicate-distributed_as.description: The predicate 'distributed as' indicates a transformation or representation of the subject (e.g., pedestrian data) into a specific form or structure that is equivalent to, or analogous with, the object (e.g., manifolds). This relationship suggests an abstract mapping or projection from one domain to another, allowing for the comparison and analysis of complex systems in different contexts.

Predicate-use.label: use
Predicate-use.description: To employ or apply a particular method, technique, or approach to achieve a specific purpose or goal. The predicate 'use' indicates that the subject (a person, entity, or system) utilizes the object (an idea, tool, process, etc.) for some intended outcome.

Predicate-suggest_to_use.label: suggest to use
Predicate-suggest_to_use.description: The predicate 'suggest to use' indicates a recommendation or proposal from the subject (in this case, manifold learning methods) for utilizing the object (Euclidean distance). It implies that the subject has identified the object as a suitable or effective approach, method, or technique.

Predicate-combine_with.label: combine with
Predicate-combine_with.description: To combine with indicates a process of integrating or uniting two entities (subject and object), resulting in a new whole that represents their connection. This predicate suggests a harmonious fusion, where distinct elements are brought together to form a cohesive entity.

Predicate-use_for_approximating.label: use for approximating
Predicate-use_for_approximating.description: The predicate 'use for approximating' indicates a relationship where the subject (a method or technique) employs its capabilities to approximate or estimate the object, which represents some quantity or concept. This connection highlights how the subject's functionality enables an approximation of the object's characteristics.

Predicate-suggest_to_use_the_Euclidean_d.label: suggest to use the Euclidean distance in
Predicate-suggest_to_use_the_Euclidean_d.description: To propose or recommend using a specific metric (Euclidean distance) for measuring similarity within a particular context or scope (indicated by 'in').

Predicate-is_critical_for.label: is critical for
Predicate-is_critical_for.description: The predicate 'is critical for' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) has a crucial or essential role in achieving or sustaining another entity (the object). This connection suggests that the subject is vital to the existence, success, or effectiveness of the object.

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To suggest or recommend a plan of action, approach, or solution to achieve a specific goal or objective.

Predicate-deal_with.label: deal with
Predicate-deal_with.description: To address or manage a situation, issue, or challenge by taking action to resolve, overcome, or cope with it.

Predicate-improve.label: improve
Predicate-improve.description: To improve means to enhance or increase the quality, effectiveness, or efficiency of something. It implies a positive change or enhancement in the object, which can be an abstract concept (e.g., learning), a process (e.g., communication), or even a physical entity (e.g., infrastructure). The subject is responsible for bringing about this improvement.

Predicate-by.label: by
Predicate-by.description: The predicate 'by' indicates agency or means of action. It connects the subject to an object that specifies how or through which process something was done, achieved, or characterized.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: The predicate 'show that' indicates a demonstration or evidence-based confirmation of a particular fact, claim, or relationship between entities. It implies a process of investigation, experimentation, observation, or analysis that leads to a conclusion or proof.

Predicate-are_effective_in.label: are effective in
Predicate-are_effective_in.description: Indicates that the subject has a causal relationship with achieving success or producing desired outcomes within the scope of the object. The predicate suggests that the subject's presence, application, or implementation leads to effective results in the context specified by the object.

Predicate-significantly_outperforms.label: significantly outperforms
Predicate-significantly_outperforms.description: Indicates that the subject has a substantial advantage or superiority over the object in terms of performance, achievement, or outcome.

Predicate-presented.label: presented
Predicate-presented.description: To present something means to introduce or display it in a way that makes its existence, significance, or value known. The predicate 'presented' indicates the act of bringing forth or making available information, ideas, research findings, or other content for consideration, discussion, or evaluation.

Predicate-may_be_useful_for.label: may be useful for
Predicate-may_be_useful_for.description: The predicate 'may be useful for' indicates a potential application or practical value of the subject (study) with respect to achieving a specific goal, outcome, or objective represented by the object (new designs of deep models for person re-identification). It suggests that the study has the capacity to contribute meaningfully towards realizing the desired outcome.

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes
Predicate-proposes.description: To propose means to suggest or recommend something as a solution, approach, or idea. The predicate 'proposes' indicates that the subject (in this case, training a robust CNN for person re-identification) presents its findings or methodology as a proposal or suggestion for consideration.

Predicate-learned_through.label: learned through
Predicate-learned_through.description: The predicate 'learned through' indicates a means or mechanism by which something (the subject) acquired knowledge, understanding, or insight. It suggests that the subject's learning was facilitated or enabled by the object, implying a causal relationship between the two.

Predicate-learn.label: learn
Predicate-learn.description: To acquire or gain knowledge, skills, or understanding about a specific topic, concept, or subject matter.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subclass of the object concept. It represents an is-a relationship between the two, where the subject has a more narrow definition than the object.
